Material used.Description: Cultured substantia nigra dopaminergic neurons were prepared from PINK1 knockout mice.

Readout description.Result Description: PARK6 mutant (G309D) PINK1 failed to restore mitochondrial membrane potential and inhibit ROS formation.
PARK6 mutant (E417G) PINK1 failed to restore mitochondrial membrane potential and inhibit ROS formation.
PARK6 mutant (CΔ145) PINK1 failed to restore mitochondrial membrane potential and inhibit ROS formation.

Biological replicates.Description: The study included multiple experiments with different batches of PINK1 knockout mice.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was imaged multiple times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: PINK1 knockout neurons without any overexpression served as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA followed by Dunnett's test and unpaired Student's t-test (two-tailed).

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Mitochondrial membrane potential (ΔΨm) maintained at hyperpolarized state and ROS levels within normal range.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Depolarized mitochondrial membrane potential and elevated ROS levels.

Material used.Description: Mitochondrial and cytosolic fractions of cultured SN neurons were prepared from PINK1 knockout mice.

Readout description.Result Description: PARK6 mutant (G309D) PINK1 failed to restore mitochondrial membrane potential and inhibit ROS formation.
PARK6 mutant (E417G) PINK1 failed to restore mitochondrial membrane potential and inhibit ROS formation.
PARK6 mutant (CΔ145) PINK1 failed to restore mitochondrial membrane potential and inhibit ROS formation.

Biological replicates.Description: The study included multiple experiments with different batches of PINK1 knockout mice.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed multiple times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: PINK1 knockout neurons without any overexpression served as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA followed by Dunnett's test and unpaired Student's t-test (two-tailed).

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Proper expression of HA-tagged PINK1 in mitochondrial fraction.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Reduced or no expression of HA-tagged PINK1 in mitochondrial fraction.
